metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7744 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
wolfSSL (formerly CyaSSL) before 3.6.8 does not properly handle faults associated with the Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT) process when allowing ephemeral key exchange without low memory optimizations on a server, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain private RSA keys by capturing TLS handshakes, aka a Lenstra attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-client - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-common - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-server - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-test - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-client - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-common - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-server - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> affects MySQL 5.5.45 and earlier, 5.6.26 and earlier

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.46-1ubuntu0.14.04.2').
mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.46-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
mysql-5.6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.27-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
